data.title: Simon Templeman
data.meta_description: Explore the filmography of Simon Templeman on Rotten Tomatoes! Discover ratings, reviews, and more. Click for details!
data.text:
Highest Rated: 14% The Young Unknowns (2000)

Lowest Rated: 14% The Young Unknowns (2000)

Birthday: Not Available

Birthplace: Sussex, England, UK

Actor Simon Templeman was most recognized for his roles in television. At the beginning of his acting career, Templeman appeared in various television sitcoms like "Mad About You" (NBC, 1992-99) and "Moon Over Miami" (ABC, 1993-94). He also appeared in the TV movie "Silent Cries" (NBC, 1992-93). In the beginning of his Hollywood career, Templeman acted in films like "The Russia House" (1990) with Sean Connery. Templeman also brought characters to life with his vocal talents in "James Bond, Jr." (1991-93). Several more television roles followed in the nineties, including stints on "Ned and Stacey" (1995-97), "Partners" (CBS, 1995-2000) and "Can't Hurry Love" (CBS, 1995-96). He also appeared in "Just Shoot Me" (NBC, 1997-2003). In his more recent career, he tackled roles on "The Agency" (2001-03), "Philly" (ABC, 2001-02) and "The Division" (Lifetime, 2001-04). He also appeared in "Modern Family" (ABC, 2009-). He also appeared in the Devon Gummersall drama "The Young Unknowns" (2003). Most recently, Templeman acted on "The Odd Couple" (CBS, 2015-17). Templeman was married to Rosalind Chao.

Highest rated movies

14% The Young Unknowns
